attributes.action: Increase the maintenance loan to cover basic living costs
attributes.additional_details:
Many students are put off going to university due to the cost of living. Everyone should have an equal opportunity to go to university and it should be a given that maintenance loans cover the cost of accommodation at a minimum 

Factors such as location (other than London), accommodation prices, living costs and familial relationships are not taken into account, which can lead to deeper financial worries and stresses.
attributes.background: For many students the maintenance loan does not even cover their accommodation, let alone food and other essentials. The currently systems fails to account for siblings, parental relationships or other financial strains and therefore puts capable students off university

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the amount of maintenance loans, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's not clear if you want the amount of all maintenance loans to be increased, and if so by how much, or for rules on how maintenance loans take certain factors, such as location or parental income, into account.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Extend the Maintenance loan to cover part time distance learning students: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580270

Improve postgraduate degree loans by covering full tuition and maintenance: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573787

Offer all students the full maintenance loan no matter what their parents earn: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575973
